optimization.validation.pso_bounds_validator¶

Source: src\optimization\validation\pso_bounds_validator.py

Module Overview¶

PSO Bounds Validation and Optimization Module.

This module provides comprehensive validation and optimization of PSO parameter bounds for control system optimization. It ensures bounds are appropriate for each controller type and provides intelligent bounds adjustment based on system characteristics.

Features:

  • Controller-specific bounds validation

  • Automatic bounds adjustment for stability

  • Theoretical bounds derivation from system parameters

  • Bounds optimization for convergence

  • Statistical validation of bounds effectiveness

References:

  • Franklin, G.F., et al. “Feedback Control of Dynamic Systems”

  • Utkin, V. “Sliding Modes in Control and Optimization”

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#================ src/optimization/validation/pso_bounds_validator.py =================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6PSO Bounds Validation and Optimization Module.
  7
  8This module provides comprehensive validation and optimization of PSO parameter bounds
  9for control system optimization. It ensures bounds are appropriate for each controller
 10type and provides intelligent bounds adjustment based on system characteristics.
 11
 12Features:
 13- Controller-specific bounds validation
 14- Automatic bounds adjustment for stability
 15- Theoretical bounds derivation from system parameters
 16- Bounds optimization for convergence
 17- Statistical validation of bounds effectiveness
 18
 19References:
 20- Franklin, G.F., et al. "Feedback Control of Dynamic Systems"
 21- Utkin, V. "Sliding Modes in Control and Optimization"
 22"""
 23
 24from __future__ import annotations
 25
 26import logging
 27import numpy as np
 28from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional, Tuple
 29from dataclasses import dataclass
 30
 31from src.config import ConfigSchema
 32from src.utils.numerical_stability import EPSILON_DIV
 33
 34
 35@dataclass
 36class BoundsValidationResult:
 37    """Result of bounds validation analysis."""
 38    is_valid: bool
 39    warnings: List[str]
 40    recommendations: List[str]
 41    adjusted_bounds: Optional[Dict[str, Tuple[List[float], List[float]]]]
 42    stability_analysis: Dict[str, Any]
 43    convergence_estimate: float
 44
 45
 46class PSOBoundsValidator:
 47    """
 48    Advanced PSO bounds validator for control system optimization.
 49
 50    This class provides comprehensive validation and optimization of PSO parameter
 51    bounds to ensure effective controller tuning.
 52    """
 53
 54    def __init__(self, config: ConfigSchema):
 55        self.config = config
 56        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
 57
 58        # Controller-specific parameter interpretations
 59        self.controller_params = {
 60            'classical_smc': {
 61                'param_names': ['k1', 'k2', 'lambda1', 'lambda2', 'K', 'kd'],
 62                'param_roles': ['position_gain', 'velocity_gain', 'surface_slope1',
 63                              'surface_slope2', 'switching_gain', 'derivative_gain'],
 64                'stability_constraints': self._classical_smc_constraints,
 65                'recommended_ranges': {
 66                    'k1': (1.0, 100.0),      # Position gain
 67                    'k2': (1.0, 100.0),      # Velocity gain
 68                    'lambda1': (0.1, 50.0),  # Surface slope for θ1
 69                    'lambda2': (0.1, 50.0),  # Surface slope for θ2
 70                    'K': (1.0, 200.0),       # Switching gain
 71                    'kd': (0.1, 20.0)        # Derivative gain
 72                }
 73            },
 74            'sta_smc': {
 75                'param_names': ['k1', 'k2', 'lambda1', 'lambda2', 'alpha', 'beta'],
 76                'param_roles': ['position_gain', 'velocity_gain', 'surface_slope1',
 77                              'surface_slope2', 'sta_gain1', 'sta_gain2'],
 78                'stability_constraints': self._sta_smc_constraints,
 79                'recommended_ranges': {
 80                    'k1': (1.0, 80.0),
 81                    'k2': (1.0, 80.0),
 82                    'lambda1': (0.5, 30.0),
 83                    'lambda2': (0.5, 30.0),
 84                    'alpha': (0.1, 10.0),    # STA gain 1
 85                    'beta': (0.1, 10.0)      # STA gain 2
 86                }
 87            },
 88            'adaptive_smc': {
 89                'param_names': ['k1', 'k2', 'lambda1', 'lambda2', 'gamma'],
 90                'param_roles': ['position_gain', 'velocity_gain', 'surface_slope1',
 91                              'surface_slope2', 'adaptation_rate'],
 92                'stability_constraints': self._adaptive_smc_constraints,
 93                'recommended_ranges': {
 94                    'k1': (1.0, 60.0),
 95                    'k2': (1.0, 60.0),
 96                    'lambda1': (0.5, 25.0),
 97                    'lambda2': (0.5, 25.0),
 98                    'gamma': (0.1, 10.0)     # Adaptation rate
 99                }
100            },
101            'hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc': {
102                'param_names': ['k1', 'k2', 'gamma1', 'gamma2'],
103                'param_roles': ['hybrid_gain1', 'hybrid_gain2', 'adapt_rate1', 'adapt_rate2'],
104                'stability_constraints': self._hybrid_constraints,
105                'recommended_ranges': {
106                    'k1': (1.0, 50.0),
107                    'k2': (1.0, 50.0),
108                    'gamma1': (0.1, 5.0),
109                    'gamma2': (0.1, 5.0)
110                }
111            }
112        }
113
114    def validate_bounds(self, controller_type: str,
115                       bounds_min: List[float],
116                       bounds_max: List[float]) -> BoundsValidationResult:
117        """
118        Comprehensive validation of PSO bounds for a specific controller.
119
120        Parameters
121        ----------
122        controller_type : str
123            Type of controller ('classical_smc', 'sta_smc', etc.)
124        bounds_min : List[float]
125            Lower bounds for optimization
126        bounds_max : List[float]
127            Upper bounds for optimization
128
129        Returns
130        -------
131        BoundsValidationResult
132            Comprehensive validation results with recommendations
133        """
134        warnings_list = []
135        recommendations = []
136        is_valid = True
137
138        # Basic validation
139        if len(bounds_min) != len(bounds_max):
140            warnings_list.append("Bounds min/max lengths don't match")
141            is_valid = False
142
143        if not all(b_min < b_max for b_min, b_max in zip(bounds_min, bounds_max)):
144            warnings_list.append("Some lower bounds are not less than upper bounds")
145            is_valid = False
146
147        # Controller-specific validation
148        if controller_type not in self.controller_params:
149            warnings_list.append(f"Unknown controller type: {controller_type}")
150            is_valid = False
151        else:
152            ctrl_info = self.controller_params[controller_type]
153            expected_count = len(ctrl_info['param_names'])
154
155            if len(bounds_min) != expected_count:
156                warnings_list.append(
157                    f"Expected {expected_count} parameters for {controller_type}, "
158                    f"got {len(bounds_min)}"
159                )
160                is_valid = False
161
162            # Check against recommended ranges
163            for i, (param_name, (rec_min, rec_max)) in enumerate(ctrl_info['recommended_ranges'].items()):
164                if i < len(bounds_min):
165                    if bounds_min[i] < rec_min * 0.1:  # Allow 10x smaller
166                        warnings_list.append(
167                            f"Lower bound for {param_name} ({bounds_min[i]:.3f}) "
168                            f"is very small (recommended min: {rec_min:.3f})"
169                        )
170                    if bounds_max[i] > rec_max * 10:  # Allow 10x larger
171                        warnings_list.append(
172                            f"Upper bound for {param_name} ({bounds_max[i]:.3f}) "
173                            f"is very large (recommended max: {rec_max:.3f})"
174                        )
175
176        # Stability analysis
177        stability_analysis = self._analyze_stability_constraints(
178            controller_type, bounds_min, bounds_max
179        )
180
181        if not stability_analysis['satisfies_constraints']:
182            warnings_list.append("Bounds may lead to unstable controllers")
183            is_valid = False
184
185        # Convergence analysis
186        convergence_estimate = self._estimate_convergence_difficulty(
187            bounds_min, bounds_max
188        )
189
190        if convergence_estimate > 0.8:
191            warnings_list.append("Bounds are very wide; convergence may be slow")
192            recommendations.append("Consider narrowing bounds based on preliminary tuning")
193
194        # Generate adjusted bounds if needed
195        adjusted_bounds = None
196        if not is_valid or warnings_list:
197            adjusted_bounds = self._generate_improved_bounds(controller_type)
198
199        return BoundsValidationResult(
200            is_valid=is_valid,
201            warnings=warnings_list,
202            recommendations=recommendations,
203            adjusted_bounds=adjusted_bounds,
204            stability_analysis=stability_analysis,
205            convergence_estimate=convergence_estimate
206        )
207
208    def _classical_smc_constraints(self, bounds_min: List[float],
209                                  bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
210        """Stability constraints for classical SMC."""
211        constraints = {
212            'satisfies_constraints': True,
213            'constraint_violations': [],
214            'recommendations': []
215        }
216
217        # k1, k2 > 0 (basic positivity)
218        if bounds_min[0] <= 0 or bounds_min[1] <= 0:
219            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
220            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("Position/velocity gains must be positive")
221
222        # λ1, λ2 > 0 (sliding surface slopes must be positive)
223        if bounds_min[2] <= 0 or bounds_min[3] <= 0:
224            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
225            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("Surface slopes must be positive")
226
227        # K > 0 (switching gain must be positive)
228        if bounds_min[4] <= 0:
229            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
230            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("Switching gain must be positive")
231
232        # kd >= 0 (derivative gain can be zero)
233        if bounds_min[5] < 0:
234            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
235            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("Derivative gain must be non-negative")
236
237        # Hurwitz condition approximation: λ values should be reasonable
238        max_lambda = max(bounds_max[2], bounds_max[3])
239        if max_lambda > 100:
240            constraints['recommendations'].append(
241                "Very large surface slopes may cause chattering"
242            )
243
244        return constraints
245
246    def _sta_smc_constraints(self, bounds_min: List[float],
247                            bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
248        """Stability constraints for super-twisting SMC."""
249        constraints = {
250            'satisfies_constraints': True,
251            'constraint_violations': [],
252            'recommendations': []
253        }
254
255        # Basic positivity for all gains
256        if any(b <= 0 for b in bounds_min[:4]):
257            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
258            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("All primary gains must be positive")
259
260        # STA stability condition: α, β > 0
261        if bounds_min[4] <= 0 or bounds_min[5] <= 0:
262            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
263            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("STA gains (α, β) must be positive")
264
265        # STA convergence condition approximation: α² > β
266        min_alpha_sq = bounds_min[4] ** 2
267        max_beta = bounds_max[5]
268        if min_alpha_sq <= max_beta:
269            constraints['recommendations'].append(
270                "Consider ensuring α² > β for better STA convergence"
271            )
272
273        return constraints
274
275    def _adaptive_smc_constraints(self, bounds_min: List[float],
276                                 bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
277        """Stability constraints for adaptive SMC."""
278        constraints = {
279            'satisfies_constraints': True,
280            'constraint_violations': [],
281            'recommendations': []
282        }
283
284        # Basic positivity
285        if any(b <= 0 for b in bounds_min):
286            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
287            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("All gains must be positive")
288
289        # Adaptation rate should be reasonable
290        if bounds_max[4] > 50:  # gamma
291            constraints['recommendations'].append(
292                "Very high adaptation rates may cause instability"
293            )
294
295        if bounds_min[4] < 0.01:
296            constraints['recommendations'].append(
297                "Very low adaptation rates may prevent convergence"
298            )
299
300        return constraints
301
302    def _hybrid_constraints(self, bounds_min: List[float],
303                           bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
304        """Stability constraints for hybrid adaptive-STA SMC."""
305        constraints = {
306            'satisfies_constraints': True,
307            'constraint_violations': [],
308            'recommendations': []
309        }
310
311        # All gains must be positive
312        if any(b <= 0 for b in bounds_min):
313            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
314            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("All gains must be positive")
315
316        # Adaptation rates should be balanced
317        gamma_ratio = bounds_max[3] / bounds_max[2] if bounds_max[2] > 0 else float('inf')
318        if gamma_ratio > 10 or gamma_ratio < 0.1:
319            constraints['recommendations'].append(
320                "Consider balancing adaptation rates (γ1 and γ2)"
321            )
322
323        return constraints
324
325    def _analyze_stability_constraints(self, controller_type: str,
326                                     bounds_min: List[float],
327                                     bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
328        """Analyze stability constraints for given bounds."""
329        if controller_type not in self.controller_params:
330            return {'satisfies_constraints': False, 'error': 'Unknown controller type'}
331
332        ctrl_info = self.controller_params[controller_type]
333        return ctrl_info['stability_constraints'](bounds_min, bounds_max)
334
335    def _estimate_convergence_difficulty(self, bounds_min: List[float],
336                                       bounds_max: List[float]) -> float:
337        """Estimate convergence difficulty based on bounds width."""
338        ranges = [b_max - b_min for b_min, b_max in zip(bounds_min, bounds_max)]
339        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
340        normalized_ranges = [r / (abs(b_min) + abs(b_max) + EPSILON_DIV)
341                           for r, b_min, b_max in zip(ranges, bounds_min, bounds_max)]
342
343        # Return mean normalized range as difficulty metric (0-1 scale)
344        difficulty = np.mean(normalized_ranges)
345        return min(difficulty, 1.0)
346
347    def _generate_improved_bounds(self, controller_type: str) -> Dict[str, Tuple[List[float], List[float]]]:
348        """Generate improved bounds based on theoretical analysis."""
349        if controller_type not in self.controller_params:
350            return {}
351
352        ctrl_info = self.controller_params[controller_type]
353        rec_ranges = ctrl_info['recommended_ranges']
354
355        # Extract system parameters for bounds scaling
356        try:
357            physics = self.config.physics
358            # Characteristic frequency based on pendulum lengths
359            char_freq = np.sqrt(physics.gravity / max(physics.pendulum1_length,
360                                                     physics.pendulum2_length))
361
362            # Scale gains based on system characteristics
363            max(physics.pendulum1_inertia, physics.pendulum2_inertia)
364            mass_scale = physics.cart_mass + physics.pendulum1_mass + physics.pendulum2_mass
365
366            scale_factor = np.sqrt(mass_scale * char_freq)
367        except Exception:
368            scale_factor = 1.0
369
370        improved_bounds = {}
371
372        for param_name, (rec_min, rec_max) in rec_ranges.items():
373            if 'gain' in param_name or param_name in ['k1', 'k2', 'K']:
374                # Scale force/acceleration gains
375                scaled_min = rec_min * scale_factor * 0.5
376                scaled_max = rec_max * scale_factor * 2.0
377            elif 'lambda' in param_name:
378                # Frequency-related parameters
379                scaled_min = rec_min * char_freq * 0.5
380                scaled_max = rec_max * char_freq * 2.0
381            else:
382                # Conservative scaling for other parameters
383                scaled_min = rec_min * 0.8
384                scaled_max = rec_max * 1.2
385
386            improved_bounds[param_name] = (scaled_min, scaled_max)
387
388        # Convert to lists for controller type
389        param_names = ctrl_info['param_names']
390        bounds_min = [improved_bounds[name][0] for name in param_names]
391        bounds_max = [improved_bounds[name][1] for name in param_names]
392
393        return {
394            controller_type: (bounds_min, bounds_max)
395        }
396
397    def optimize_bounds_for_convergence(self, controller_type: str,
398                                       initial_bounds: Tuple[List[float], List[float]],
399                                       target_convergence_time: float = 50) -> Tuple[List[float], List[float]]:
400        """
401        Optimize bounds to achieve target convergence time.
402
403        Parameters
404        ----------
405        controller_type : str
406            Type of controller
407        initial_bounds : Tuple[List[float], List[float]]
408            Initial (min, max) bounds
409        target_convergence_time : float
410            Target PSO convergence time in iterations
411
412        Returns
413        -------
414        Tuple[List[float], List[float]]
415            Optimized (min, max) bounds
416        """
417        bounds_min, bounds_max = initial_bounds
418
419        # Estimate search space volume
420        volume = np.prod([b_max - b_min for b_min, b_max in zip(bounds_min, bounds_max)])
421
422        # Adjust bounds based on convergence target
423        if volume > target_convergence_time * 1000:  # Heuristic threshold
424            # Reduce bounds by narrowing around recommended centers
425            if controller_type in self.controller_params:
426                rec_ranges = self.controller_params[controller_type]['recommended_ranges']
427                param_names = self.controller_params[controller_type]['param_names']
428
429                optimized_min = []
430                optimized_max = []
431
432                for i, param_name in enumerate(param_names):
433                    if param_name in rec_ranges:
434                        rec_min, rec_max = rec_ranges[param_name]
435                        center = (rec_min + rec_max) / 2
436                        half_range = (rec_max - rec_min) / 4  # Narrower range
437
438                        optimized_min.append(max(bounds_min[i], center - half_range))
439                        optimized_max.append(min(bounds_max[i], center + half_range))
440                    else:
441                        # Keep original bounds for unknown parameters
442                        optimized_min.append(bounds_min[i])
443                        optimized_max.append(bounds_max[i])
444
445                return optimized_min, optimized_max
446
447        return bounds_min, bounds_max
448
449    def generate_bounds_report(self, controller_type: str) -> str:
450        """Generate a comprehensive bounds analysis report."""
451        if controller_type not in self.controller_params:
452            return f"Unknown controller type: {controller_type}"
453
454        ctrl_info = self.controller_params[controller_type]
455
456        report = f"""
457PSO Bounds Analysis Report for {controller_type.upper()}
458{'=' * 60}
459
460Parameter Information:
461"""
462
463        for i, (param_name, role) in enumerate(zip(ctrl_info['param_names'], ctrl_info['param_roles'])):
464            rec_range = ctrl_info['recommended_ranges'].get(param_name, (0, 0))
465            report += f"  {i+1}. {param_name} ({role})\n"
466            report += f"     Recommended range: [{rec_range[0]:.1f}, {rec_range[1]:.1f}]\n"
467
468        report += """
469Stability Considerations:
470  - All gains must be positive for stability
471  - Switching gains should be large enough to overcome uncertainties
472  - Surface slopes should ensure reasonable reaching time
473  - Avoid excessively large gains to prevent chattering
474
475Convergence Tips:
476  - Start with narrow bounds around recommended values
477  - Gradually widen if global optimum is not found
478  - Consider multi-stage optimization with adaptive bounds
479  - Monitor convergence rate and adjust accordingly
480
481System-Specific Scaling:
482  - Gains should scale with system inertia and characteristic frequencies
483  - Consider actuator saturation limits in bounds selection
484  - Account for measurement noise in derivative gains
485"""
486
487        return report
488
489
490def validate_pso_configuration(config: ConfigSchema) -> BoundsValidationResult:
491    """
492    Validate complete PSO configuration for all controllers.
493
494    Parameters
495    ----------
496    config : ConfigSchema
497        Complete system configuration
498
499    Returns
500    -------
501    BoundsValidationResult
502        Aggregated validation results for all controllers
503    """
504    validator = PSOBoundsValidator(config)
505
506    all_warnings = []
507    all_recommendations = []
508    all_valid = True
509    all_adjusted_bounds = {}
510
511    # Check each controller type in PSO bounds
512    pso_bounds = config.pso.bounds
513
514    # Default bounds
515    default_validation = validator.validate_bounds(
516        'classical_smc',  # Use as reference
517        pso_bounds.min,
518        pso_bounds.max
519    )
520
521    if not default_validation.is_valid:
522        all_valid = False
523        all_warnings.extend([f"Default bounds: {w}" for w in default_validation.warnings])
524
525    # Controller-specific bounds
526    controller_types = ['classical_smc', 'sta_smc', 'adaptive_smc', 'hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc']
527
528    for ctrl_type in controller_types:
529        if hasattr(pso_bounds, ctrl_type):
530            ctrl_bounds = getattr(pso_bounds, ctrl_type)
531            if ctrl_bounds is not None:
532                validation = validator.validate_bounds(
533                    ctrl_type,
534                    ctrl_bounds.min,
535                    ctrl_bounds.max
536                )
537
538                if not validation.is_valid:
539                    all_valid = False
540                    all_warnings.extend([f"{ctrl_type}: {w}" for w in validation.warnings])
541
542                all_recommendations.extend([f"{ctrl_type}: {r}" for r in validation.recommendations])
543
544                if validation.adjusted_bounds:
545                    all_adjusted_bounds.update(validation.adjusted_bounds)
546
547    return BoundsValidationResult(
548        is_valid=all_valid,
549        warnings=all_warnings,
550        recommendations=all_recommendations,
551        adjusted_bounds=all_adjusted_bounds if all_adjusted_bounds else None,
552        stability_analysis={'overall_valid': all_valid},
553        convergence_estimate=0.5  # Average estimate
554    )

Classes¶

BoundsValidationResult¶

Result of bounds validation analysis.

Source Code¶

1@dataclass
2class BoundsValidationResult:
3    """Result of bounds validation analysis."""
4    is_valid: bool
5    warnings: List[str]
6    recommendations: List[str]
7    adjusted_bounds: Optional[Dict[str, Tuple[List[float], List[float]]]]

PSOBoundsValidator¶

Advanced PSO bounds validator for control system optimization.

This class provides comprehensive validation and optimization of PSO parameter bounds to ensure effective controller tuning.

Source Code¶

  1class PSOBoundsValidator:
  2    """
  3    Advanced PSO bounds validator for control system optimization.
  4
  5    This class provides comprehensive validation and optimization of PSO parameter
  6    bounds to ensure effective controller tuning.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, config: ConfigSchema):
 10        self.config = config
 11        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
 12
 13        # Controller-specific parameter interpretations
 14        self.controller_params = {
 15            'classical_smc': {
 16                'param_names': ['k1', 'k2', 'lambda1', 'lambda2', 'K', 'kd'],
 17                'param_roles': ['position_gain', 'velocity_gain', 'surface_slope1',
 18                              'surface_slope2', 'switching_gain', 'derivative_gain'],
 19                'stability_constraints': self._classical_smc_constraints,
 20                'recommended_ranges': {
 21                    'k1': (1.0, 100.0),      # Position gain
 22                    'k2': (1.0, 100.0),      # Velocity gain
 23                    'lambda1': (0.1, 50.0),  # Surface slope for θ1
 24                    'lambda2': (0.1, 50.0),  # Surface slope for θ2
 25                    'K': (1.0, 200.0),       # Switching gain
 26                    'kd': (0.1, 20.0)        # Derivative gain
 27                }
 28            },
 29            'sta_smc': {
 30                'param_names': ['k1', 'k2', 'lambda1', 'lambda2', 'alpha', 'beta'],
 31                'param_roles': ['position_gain', 'velocity_gain', 'surface_slope1',
 32                              'surface_slope2', 'sta_gain1', 'sta_gain2'],
 33                'stability_constraints': self._sta_smc_constraints,
 34                'recommended_ranges': {
 35                    'k1': (1.0, 80.0),
 36                    'k2': (1.0, 80.0),
 37                    'lambda1': (0.5, 30.0),
 38                    'lambda2': (0.5, 30.0),
 39                    'alpha': (0.1, 10.0),    # STA gain 1
 40                    'beta': (0.1, 10.0)      # STA gain 2
 41                }
 42            },
 43            'adaptive_smc': {
 44                'param_names': ['k1', 'k2', 'lambda1', 'lambda2', 'gamma'],
 45                'param_roles': ['position_gain', 'velocity_gain', 'surface_slope1',
 46                              'surface_slope2', 'adaptation_rate'],
 47                'stability_constraints': self._adaptive_smc_constraints,
 48                'recommended_ranges': {
 49                    'k1': (1.0, 60.0),
 50                    'k2': (1.0, 60.0),
 51                    'lambda1': (0.5, 25.0),
 52                    'lambda2': (0.5, 25.0),
 53                    'gamma': (0.1, 10.0)     # Adaptation rate
 54                }
 55            },
 56            'hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc': {
 57                'param_names': ['k1', 'k2', 'gamma1', 'gamma2'],
 58                'param_roles': ['hybrid_gain1', 'hybrid_gain2', 'adapt_rate1', 'adapt_rate2'],
 59                'stability_constraints': self._hybrid_constraints,
 60                'recommended_ranges': {
 61                    'k1': (1.0, 50.0),
 62                    'k2': (1.0, 50.0),
 63                    'gamma1': (0.1, 5.0),
 64                    'gamma2': (0.1, 5.0)
 65                }
 66            }
 67        }
 68
 69    def validate_bounds(self, controller_type: str,
 70                       bounds_min: List[float],
 71                       bounds_max: List[float]) -> BoundsValidationResult:
 72        """
 73        Comprehensive validation of PSO bounds for a specific controller.
 74
 75        Parameters
 76        ----------
 77        controller_type : str
 78            Type of controller ('classical_smc', 'sta_smc', etc.)
 79        bounds_min : List[float]
 80            Lower bounds for optimization
 81        bounds_max : List[float]
 82            Upper bounds for optimization
 83
 84        Returns
 85        -------
 86        BoundsValidationResult
 87            Comprehensive validation results with recommendations
 88        """
 89        warnings_list = []
 90        recommendations = []
 91        is_valid = True
 92
 93        # Basic validation
 94        if len(bounds_min) != len(bounds_max):
 95            warnings_list.append("Bounds min/max lengths don't match")
 96            is_valid = False
 97
 98        if not all(b_min < b_max for b_min, b_max in zip(bounds_min, bounds_max)):
 99            warnings_list.append("Some lower bounds are not less than upper bounds")
100            is_valid = False
101
102        # Controller-specific validation
103        if controller_type not in self.controller_params:
104            warnings_list.append(f"Unknown controller type: {controller_type}")
105            is_valid = False
106        else:
107            ctrl_info = self.controller_params[controller_type]
108            expected_count = len(ctrl_info['param_names'])
109
110            if len(bounds_min) != expected_count:
111                warnings_list.append(
112                    f"Expected {expected_count} parameters for {controller_type}, "
113                    f"got {len(bounds_min)}"
114                )
115                is_valid = False
116
117            # Check against recommended ranges
118            for i, (param_name, (rec_min, rec_max)) in enumerate(ctrl_info['recommended_ranges'].items()):
119                if i < len(bounds_min):
120                    if bounds_min[i] < rec_min * 0.1:  # Allow 10x smaller
121                        warnings_list.append(
122                            f"Lower bound for {param_name} ({bounds_min[i]:.3f}) "
123                            f"is very small (recommended min: {rec_min:.3f})"
124                        )
125                    if bounds_max[i] > rec_max * 10:  # Allow 10x larger
126                        warnings_list.append(
127                            f"Upper bound for {param_name} ({bounds_max[i]:.3f}) "
128                            f"is very large (recommended max: {rec_max:.3f})"
129                        )
130
131        # Stability analysis
132        stability_analysis = self._analyze_stability_constraints(
133            controller_type, bounds_min, bounds_max
134        )
135
136        if not stability_analysis['satisfies_constraints']:
137            warnings_list.append("Bounds may lead to unstable controllers")
138            is_valid = False
139
140        # Convergence analysis
141        convergence_estimate = self._estimate_convergence_difficulty(
142            bounds_min, bounds_max
143        )
144
145        if convergence_estimate > 0.8:
146            warnings_list.append("Bounds are very wide; convergence may be slow")
147            recommendations.append("Consider narrowing bounds based on preliminary tuning")
148
149        # Generate adjusted bounds if needed
150        adjusted_bounds = None
151        if not is_valid or warnings_list:
152            adjusted_bounds = self._generate_improved_bounds(controller_type)
153
154        return BoundsValidationResult(
155            is_valid=is_valid,
156            warnings=warnings_list,
157            recommendations=recommendations,
158            adjusted_bounds=adjusted_bounds,
159            stability_analysis=stability_analysis,
160            convergence_estimate=convergence_estimate
161        )
162
163    def _classical_smc_constraints(self, bounds_min: List[float],
164                                  bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
165        """Stability constraints for classical SMC."""
166        constraints = {
167            'satisfies_constraints': True,
168            'constraint_violations': [],
169            'recommendations': []
170        }
171
172        # k1, k2 > 0 (basic positivity)
173        if bounds_min[0] <= 0 or bounds_min[1] <= 0:
174            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
175            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("Position/velocity gains must be positive")
176
177        # λ1, λ2 > 0 (sliding surface slopes must be positive)
178        if bounds_min[2] <= 0 or bounds_min[3] <= 0:
179            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
180            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("Surface slopes must be positive")
181
182        # K > 0 (switching gain must be positive)
183        if bounds_min[4] <= 0:
184            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
185            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("Switching gain must be positive")
186
187        # kd >= 0 (derivative gain can be zero)
188        if bounds_min[5] < 0:
189            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
190            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("Derivative gain must be non-negative")
191
192        # Hurwitz condition approximation: λ values should be reasonable
193        max_lambda = max(bounds_max[2], bounds_max[3])
194        if max_lambda > 100:
195            constraints['recommendations'].append(
196                "Very large surface slopes may cause chattering"
197            )
198
199        return constraints
200
201    def _sta_smc_constraints(self, bounds_min: List[float],
202                            bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
203        """Stability constraints for super-twisting SMC."""
204        constraints = {
205            'satisfies_constraints': True,
206            'constraint_violations': [],
207            'recommendations': []
208        }
209
210        # Basic positivity for all gains
211        if any(b <= 0 for b in bounds_min[:4]):
212            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
213            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("All primary gains must be positive")
214
215        # STA stability condition: α, β > 0
216        if bounds_min[4] <= 0 or bounds_min[5] <= 0:
217            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
218            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("STA gains (α, β) must be positive")
219
220        # STA convergence condition approximation: α² > β
221        min_alpha_sq = bounds_min[4] ** 2
222        max_beta = bounds_max[5]
223        if min_alpha_sq <= max_beta:
224            constraints['recommendations'].append(
225                "Consider ensuring α² > β for better STA convergence"
226            )
227
228        return constraints
229
230    def _adaptive_smc_constraints(self, bounds_min: List[float],
231                                 bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
232        """Stability constraints for adaptive SMC."""
233        constraints = {
234            'satisfies_constraints': True,
235            'constraint_violations': [],
236            'recommendations': []
237        }
238
239        # Basic positivity
240        if any(b <= 0 for b in bounds_min):
241            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
242            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("All gains must be positive")
243
244        # Adaptation rate should be reasonable
245        if bounds_max[4] > 50:  # gamma
246            constraints['recommendations'].append(
247                "Very high adaptation rates may cause instability"
248            )
249
250        if bounds_min[4] < 0.01:
251            constraints['recommendations'].append(
252                "Very low adaptation rates may prevent convergence"
253            )
254
255        return constraints
256
257    def _hybrid_constraints(self, bounds_min: List[float],
258                           bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
259        """Stability constraints for hybrid adaptive-STA SMC."""
260        constraints = {
261            'satisfies_constraints': True,
262            'constraint_violations': [],
263            'recommendations': []
264        }
265
266        # All gains must be positive
267        if any(b <= 0 for b in bounds_min):
268            constraints['satisfies_constraints'] = False
269            constraints['constraint_violations'].append("All gains must be positive")
270
271        # Adaptation rates should be balanced
272        gamma_ratio = bounds_max[3] / bounds_max[2] if bounds_max[2] > 0 else float('inf')
273        if gamma_ratio > 10 or gamma_ratio < 0.1:
274            constraints['recommendations'].append(
275                "Consider balancing adaptation rates (γ1 and γ2)"
276            )
277
278        return constraints
279
280    def _analyze_stability_constraints(self, controller_type: str,
281                                     bounds_min: List[float],
282                                     bounds_max: List[float]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
283        """Analyze stability constraints for given bounds."""
284        if controller_type not in self.controller_params:
285            return {'satisfies_constraints': False, 'error': 'Unknown controller type'}
286
287        ctrl_info = self.controller_params[controller_type]
288        return ctrl_info['stability_constraints'](bounds_min, bounds_max)
289
290    def _estimate_convergence_difficulty(self, bounds_min: List[float],
291                                       bounds_max: List[float]) -> float:
292        """Estimate convergence difficulty based on bounds width."""
293        ranges = [b_max - b_min for b_min, b_max in zip(bounds_min, bounds_max)]
294        # Issue #13: Standardized division protection
295        normalized_ranges = [r / (abs(b_min) + abs(b_max) + EPSILON_DIV)
296                           for r, b_min, b_max in zip(ranges, bounds_min, bounds_max)]
297
298        # Return mean normalized range as difficulty metric (0-1 scale)
299        difficulty = np.mean(normalized_ranges)
300        return min(difficulty, 1.0)
301
302    def _generate_improved_bounds(self, controller_type: str) -> Dict[str, Tuple[List[float], List[float]]]:
303        """Generate improved bounds based on theoretical analysis."""
304        if controller_type not in self.controller_params:
305            return {}
306
307        ctrl_info = self.controller_params[controller_type]
308        rec_ranges = ctrl_info['recommended_ranges']
309
310        # Extract system parameters for bounds scaling
311        try:
312            physics = self.config.physics
313            # Characteristic frequency based on pendulum lengths
314            char_freq = np.sqrt(physics.gravity / max(physics.pendulum1_length,
315                                                     physics.pendulum2_length))
316
317            # Scale gains based on system characteristics
318            max(physics.pendulum1_inertia, physics.pendulum2_inertia)
319            mass_scale = physics.cart_mass + physics.pendulum1_mass + physics.pendulum2_mass
320
321            scale_factor = np.sqrt(mass_scale * char_freq)
322        except Exception:
323            scale_factor = 1.0
324
325        improved_bounds = {}
326
327        for param_name, (rec_min, rec_max) in rec_ranges.items():
328            if 'gain' in param_name or param_name in ['k1', 'k2', 'K']:
329                # Scale force/acceleration gains
330                scaled_min = rec_min * scale_factor * 0.5
331                scaled_max = rec_max * scale_factor * 2.0
332            elif 'lambda' in param_name:
333                # Frequency-related parameters
334                scaled_min = rec_min * char_freq * 0.5
335                scaled_max = rec_max * char_freq * 2.0
336            else:
337                # Conservative scaling for other parameters
338                scaled_min = rec_min * 0.8
339                scaled_max = rec_max * 1.2
340
341            improved_bounds[param_name] = (scaled_min, scaled_max)
342
343        # Convert to lists for controller type
344        param_names = ctrl_info['param_names']
345        bounds_min = [improved_bounds[name][0] for name in param_names]
346        bounds_max = [improved_bounds[name][1] for name in param_names]
347
348        return {
349            controller_type: (bounds_min, bounds_max)
350        }
351
352    def optimize_bounds_for_convergence(self, controller_type: str,
353                                       initial_bounds: Tuple[List[float], List[float]],
354                                       target_convergence_time: float = 50) -> Tuple[List[float], List[float]]:
355        """
356        Optimize bounds to achieve target convergence time.
357
358        Parameters
359        ----------
360        controller_type : str
361            Type of controller
362        initial_bounds : Tuple[List[float], List[float]]
363            Initial (min, max) bounds
364        target_convergence_time : float
365            Target PSO convergence time in iterations
366
367        Returns
368        -------
369        Tuple[List[float], List[float]]
370            Optimized (min, max) bounds
371        """
372        bounds_min, bounds_max = initial_bounds
373
374        # Estimate search space volume
375        volume = np.prod([b_max - b_min for b_min, b_max in zip(bounds_min, bounds_max)])
376
377        # Adjust bounds based on convergence target
378        if volume > target_convergence_time * 1000:  # Heuristic threshold
379            # Reduce bounds by narrowing around recommended centers
380            if controller_type in self.controller_params:
381                rec_ranges = self.controller_params[controller_type]['recommended_ranges']
382                param_names = self.controller_params[controller_type]['param_names']
383
384                optimized_min = []
385                optimized_max = []
386
387                for i, param_name in enumerate(param_names):
388                    if param_name in rec_ranges:
389                        rec_min, rec_max = rec_ranges[param_name]
390                        center = (rec_min + rec_max) / 2
391                        half_range = (rec_max - rec_min) / 4  # Narrower range
392
393                        optimized_min.append(max(bounds_min[i], center - half_range))
394                        optimized_max.append(min(bounds_max[i], center + half_range))
395                    else:
396                        # Keep original bounds for unknown parameters
397                        optimized_min.append(bounds_min[i])
398                        optimized_max.append(bounds_max[i])
399
400                return optimized_min, optimized_max
401
402        return bounds_min, bounds_max
403
404    def generate_bounds_report(self, controller_type: str) -> str:
405        """Generate a comprehensive bounds analysis report."""
406        if controller_type not in self.controller_params:
407            return f"Unknown controller type: {controller_type}"
408
409        ctrl_info = self.controller_params[controller_type]
410
411        report = f"""
412PSO Bounds Analysis Report for {controller_type.upper()}
413{'=' * 60}
414
415Parameter Information:
416"""
417
418        for i, (param_name, role) in enumerate(zip(ctrl_info['param_names'], ctrl_info['param_roles'])):
419            rec_range = ctrl_info['recommended_ranges'].get(param_name, (0, 0))
420            report += f"  {i+1}. {param_name} ({role})\n"
421            report += f"     Recommended range: [{rec_range[0]:.1f}, {rec_range[1]:.1f}]\n"
422
423        report += """
424Stability Considerations:
425  - All gains must be positive for stability
426  - Switching gains should be large enough to overcome uncertainties
427  - Surface slopes should ensure reasonable reaching time
428  - Avoid excessively large gains to prevent chattering
429
430Convergence Tips:
431  - Start with narrow bounds around recommended values
432  - Gradually widen if global optimum is not found
433  - Consider multi-stage optimization with adaptive bounds
434  - Monitor convergence rate and adjust accordingly
435
436System-Specific Scaling:
437  - Gains should scale with system inertia and characteristic frequencies
438  - Consider actuator saturation limits in bounds selection
439  - Account for measurement noise in derivative gains
440"""
441
442        return report

Functions¶

validate_pso_configuration(config)¶

Validate complete PSO configuration for all controllers.

Parameters¶

config : ConfigSchema Complete system configuration

Returns¶

BoundsValidationResult Aggregated validation results for all controllers

Source Code¶

 1def validate_pso_configuration(config: ConfigSchema) -> BoundsValidationResult:
 2    """
 3    Validate complete PSO configuration for all controllers.
 4
 5    Parameters
 6    ----------
 7    config : ConfigSchema
 8        Complete system configuration
 9
10    Returns
11    -------
12    BoundsValidationResult
13        Aggregated validation results for all controllers
14    """
15    validator = PSOBoundsValidator(config)
16
17    all_warnings = []
18    all_recommendations = []
19    all_valid = True
20    all_adjusted_bounds = {}
21
22    # Check each controller type in PSO bounds
23    pso_bounds = config.pso.bounds
24
25    # Default bounds
26    default_validation = validator.validate_bounds(
27        'classical_smc',  # Use as reference
28        pso_bounds.min,
29        pso_bounds.max
30    )
31
32    if not default_validation.is_valid:
33        all_valid = False
34        all_warnings.extend([f"Default bounds: {w}" for w in default_validation.warnings])
35
36    # Controller-specific bounds
37    controller_types = ['classical_smc', 'sta_smc', 'adaptive_smc', 'hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc']
38
39    for ctrl_type in controller_types:
40        if hasattr(pso_bounds, ctrl_type):
41            ctrl_bounds = getattr(pso_bounds, ctrl_type)
42            if ctrl_bounds is not None:
43                validation = validator.validate_bounds(
44                    ctrl_type,
45                    ctrl_bounds.min,
46                    ctrl_bounds.max
47                )
48
49                if not validation.is_valid:
50                    all_valid = False
51                    all_warnings.extend([f"{ctrl_type}: {w}" for w in validation.warnings])
52
53                all_recommendations.extend([f"{ctrl_type}: {r}" for r in validation.recommendations])
54
55                if validation.adjusted_bounds:
56                    all_adjusted_bounds.update(validation.adjusted_bounds)
57
58    return BoundsValidationResult(
59        is_valid=all_valid,
60        warnings=all_warnings,
61        recommendations=all_recommendations,
62        adjusted_bounds=all_adjusted_bounds if all_adjusted_bounds else None,
63        stability_analysis={'overall_valid': all_valid},
64        convergence_estimate=0.5  # Average estimate
65    )
